comment.value: show single package or single version

description.compact: finds a package by name and version if provided

comment.value: select preferred package according to policy rules

description.compact: Prints package info.
Prints package metadata.
Prints all available versions of this package and highlights the installed one if any.
print link objects
Prints the licenses of a package with metadata
Prints package info in JSON format.
Init styles for tree
Display the tree
Generate the package tree
Display a package tree
Display a package tree

comment.value: it needs an upgrade but has potential BC breaks so is not urgent

description.compact: Given a package, this finds the latest package matching it

comment.value: find the latest version allowed in this pool

description.compact: Removes the cached composer instance
Whether or not this command is meant to call another command.

docblock.description: This is mainly needed to avoid duplicated warnings messages.

comment.value: initialize a plugin-enabled Composer instance, either local or global

description.compact: Returns preferSource and preferDist values based on the configuration.

return.description: An array composed of the preferSource and preferDist values

param.description: The name of the command; passing null means it must be set in configure()

throws.description: When the command name is empty

description.compact: Ignores validation errors.

docblock.description: This is mainly useful for the help command.

description.compact: Gets the helper set.
Gets the application instance for this command.
Checks whether the command is enabled or not in the current environment.

docblock.description: Override this to check for x or y and return false if the command cannot run properly under the current conditions.

description.compact: Configures the current command.
Executes the current command.

docblock.description: This method is not abstract because you can use this class as a concrete class. In this case, instead of defining the execute() method, you set the code to execute by passing a Closure to the setCode() method.

return.description: 0 if everything went fine, or an exit code

throws.description: When this abstract method is not implemented

description.compact: Interacts with the user.

docblock.description: This method is executed before the InputDefinition is validated. This means that this is the only place where the command can interactively ask for values of missing required arguments.

description.compact: Initializes the command after the input has been bound and before the input is validated.

docblock.description: This is mainly useful when a lot of commands extends one main command where some things need to be initialized based on the input arguments and options.

description.compact: Runs the command.

docblock.description: The code to execute is either defined directly with the setCode() method or by overriding the execute() method in a sub-class.

throws.description: When binding input fails. Bypass this by calling {@link ignoreValidationErrors()}.

comment.value: add the application arguments and options
bind the input against the command specific arguments/options
The command name argument is often omitted when a command is executed directly with its run() method.
It would fail the validation if we didn't make sure the command argument is present,
since it's required by the application.

description.compact: Adds suggestions to $suggestions for the current completion input (e.g. option or argument).
Sets the code to execute when running this command.

docblock.description: If this method is used, it overrides the code defined in the execute() method.

description.compact: Merges the application definition with the command definition.

docblock.description: This method is not part of public API and should not be used directly.

param.description: Whether to merge or not the Application definition arguments to Command definition arguments

description.compact: Sets an array of argument and option instances.

param.description: An array of argument and option instances or a definition instance

description.compact: Gets the InputDefinition attached to this Command.
Gets the InputDefinition to be used to create representations of this Command.

docblock.description:
Can be overridden to provide the original command representation when it would otherwise be changed by merging with the application InputDefinition.
This method is not part of public API and should not be used directly.

description.compact: Adds an argument.

param.description: The argument mode: InputArgument::REQUIRED or InputArgument::OPTIONAL
The default value (for InputArgument::OPTIONAL mode only)

throws.description: When argument mode is not valid

description.compact: Adds an option.

param.description: The shortcuts, can be null, a string of shortcuts delimited by | or an array of shortcuts
The option mode: One of the InputOption::VALUE_* constants
The default value (must be null for InputOption::VALUE_NONE)

throws.description: If option mode is invalid or incompatible

description.compact: Sets the name of the command.
Sets the process title of the command.

docblock.description: This feature should be used only when creating a long process command, like a daemon.

description.compact: Returns the command name.

param.description: Whether or not the command should be hidden from the list of commands

docblock.param: The default value will be true in Symfony 6.0

return.description: whether the command should be publicly shown or not

description.compact: Sets the description for the command.
Returns the description for the command.
Sets the help for the command.
Returns the help for the command.
Returns the processed help for the command replacing the %command.name% and %command.full_name% patterns with the real values dynamically.
Sets the aliases for the command.

param.description: An array of aliases for the command

description.compact: Returns the aliases for the command.
Returns the synopsis for the command.

param.description: Whether to show the short version of the synopsis (with options folded) or not

description.compact: Add a command usage example, it'll be prefixed with the command name.
Returns alternative usages of the command.
Gets a helper instance by name.

throws.description: if the helper is not defined
